etymologies: Old English pere, peru, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch peer, from Latin pirum

definitions: a yellowish- or brownish-green edible fruit that is typically narrow at the stalk and wider toward the base, with sweet, slightly gritty flesh.
shortDefinitions: edible fruit that is narrow at stalk

definitions: the Eurasian tree which bears the pear.

notes.text: Genus Pyrus, family Rosaceae: several species and hybrids, in particular P. communis
